00146 int nfs_Read( nfs_arg_t             * parg,    
00147               exportlist_t          * pexport, 
00148               fsal_op_context_t     * pcontext,   
00149               cache_inode_client_t  * pclient,
00150               hash_table_t          * ht,
00151               struct svc_req        * preq,    
00152               nfs_res_t             * pres )
00153 {
00154   static char     funcName[] = "nfs_Read";
00155         
00156   cache_entry_t            * pentry ;
00157   fsal_attrib_list_t         attr ;
00158   fsal_attrib_list_t         pre_attr ;
00159   fsal_attrib_list_t       * ppre_attr ;
00160   int                        rc ;
00161   cache_inode_status_t       cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS;
00162   cache_content_status_t     content_status ;
00163   fsal_seek_t                seek_descriptor ;
00164   fsal_size_t                size = 0;
00165   fsal_size_t                read_size;
00166   fsal_off_t                 offset = 0;
00167   caddr_t                    data = NULL;
00168   cache_inode_file_type_t    filetype ;
00169   fsal_boolean_t             eof_met  ;
00170 
00171   cache_content_policy_data_t datapol ; 
00172 
00173   datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = FALSE ;
00174 
00175   if (preq->rq_vers == NFS_V3)
00176    {
00177         /* to avoid setting it on each error case */
00178         pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes.attributes_follow = FALSE;
00179    }
00180 
00181   
00182         /* Convert file handle into a cache entry */
00183   if( ( pentry = nfs_FhandleToCache( preq->rq_vers, 
00184                                      &(parg->arg_read2.file),
00185                                      &(parg->arg_read3.file),
00186                                      NULL, 
00187                                      &(pres->res_read2.status),
00188                                      &(pres->res_read3.status),
00189                                      NULL,
00190                                      &pre_attr, 
00191                                      pcontext, 
00192                                      pclient, 
00193                                      ht, 
00194                                      &rc ) ) == NULL )
00195     {
00196       /* Stale NFS FH ? */
00197       return rc ;
00198     }
00199 
00200   /* get directory attributes before action (for V3 reply) */
00201   ppre_attr = &pre_attr;
00202   
00203   /* Extract the filetype */
00204   filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( pre_attr.type ) ;
00205 
00206   /* Sanity check: read only from a regular file */
00207         if( filetype != REGULAR_FILE )
00208     {
00209       switch (preq->rq_vers)
00210         {
00211         case NFS_V2:
00212           /*
00213            * In the RFC tell it not good but it does
00214            * not tell what to do ... 
00215            */
00216           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_ISDIR;
00217           break;
00218 
00219         case NFS_V3:
00220           if( filetype == DIR_BEGINNING || filetype == DIR_CONTINUE )
00221             pres->res_read3.status = NFS3ERR_ISDIR ;
00222           else
00223             pres->res_read3.status = NFS3ERR_INVAL;
00224           break;
00225         }
00226   
00227       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00228     }
00229   
00230   /* For MDONLY export, reject write operation */
00231   /* Request of type MDONLY_RO were rejected at the nfs_rpc_dispatcher level */
00232   /* This is done by replying EDQUOT (this error is known for not disturbing the client's requests cache */
00233   if( pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY || pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY_RO )
00234     {
00235       switch( preq->rq_vers )
00236         {
00237         case NFS_V2:
00238           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_DQUOT ;
00239           break;
00240 
00241         case NFS_V3:
00242           pres->res_read3.status = NFS3ERR_DQUOT;
00243           break;
00244         }
00245 
00246   
00247       nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00248                            preq->rq_vers, 
00249                            cache_status,
00250                            &pres->res_read2.status,
00251                            &pres->res_read3.status,
00252                            pentry,
00253                            &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes),
00254                            NULL, NULL, NULL,
00255                            NULL, NULL, NULL);
00256       
00257       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00258     }
00259   
00260   /* Extract the argument from the request */
00261         switch( preq->rq_vers )
00262         {
00263         case NFS_V2:
00264     offset = parg->arg_read2.offset;    /* beginoffset is obsolete */
00265     size = parg->arg_read2.count;           /* totalcount is obsolete  */
00266     break;
00267 
00268         case NFS_V3:
00269     offset = parg->arg_read3.offset;
00270     size = parg->arg_read3.count;
00271 
00272 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
00273     printf( "-----> Read offset=%lld count=%u MaxOffSet=%lld\n", parg->arg_read3.offset, parg->arg_read3.count, pexport->MaxOffsetRead ) ;
00274 #endif
00275 
00276 
00277     /* 
00278      * do not exceed maxium READ/WRITE offset if set 
00279      */
00280     if( ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETREAD ) == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETREAD )
00281      if( (fsal_off_t)(offset+size) > pexport->MaxOffsetRead ) 
00282        {
00283           
00284           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT,
00285               "NFS READ: A client tryed to violate max file size %lld for exportid #%hu",
00286               pexport->MaxOffsetRead, pexport->id ) ;
00287 
00288           switch( preq->rq_vers )
00289                 {
00290                 case NFS_V2:
00291                 pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_DQUOT ;
00292                 break;
00293 
00294                 case NFS_V3:
00295                 pres->res_read3.status = NFS3ERR_INVAL;
00296                 break;
00297                 }
00298 
00299 
00300           nfs_SetFailedStatus(  pcontext, pexport,
00301                                 preq->rq_vers,
00302                                 cache_status,
00303                                 &pres->res_read2.status,
00304                                 &pres->res_read3.status,
00305                                 pentry,
00306                                 &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes),
00307                                 NULL, NULL, NULL,
00308                                 NULL, NULL, NULL);
00309 
00310           return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00311 
00312         }
00313         
00314 
00315     /*
00316      * We should not exceed the FSINFO rtmax field for
00317      * the size 
00318      */
00319     if(  ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXREAD == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXREAD ) &&
00320            size > pexport->MaxRead )
00321                         {
00322                                 /*
00323                                  * The client asked for too much, normally
00324                                  * this should not happen because the client
00325                                  * is calling nfs_Fsinfo at mount time and so
00326                                  * is aware of the server maximum write size 
00327                                  */
00328                                 size =  pexport->MaxRead ;
00329                         }
00330     break;
00331         }
00332   
00333         if (size == 0)
00334     {
00335       cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00336       read_size = 0;
00337       data = NULL;
00338         } 
00339   else
00340         {
00341                 data = Mem_Alloc( size );
00342 
00343                 if (data == NULL)
00344                 {
00345                         return NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00346                 }
00347 
00348     seek_descriptor.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET ;
00349     seek_descriptor.offset = offset ;
00350    
00351     datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXCACHESIZE ;
00352     datapol.MaxCacheSize = pexport->MaxCacheSize ;
00353  
00354     /* If export is not cached, cache it now */
00355     if( ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE ) && 
00356         ( cache_content_cache_behaviour( pentry, 
00357                                          &datapol,
00358                                          (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client, 
00359                                          &content_status ) == CACHE_CONTENT_FULLY_CACHED ) && 
00360         ( pentry->object.file.pentry_content == NULL ) )
00361       {
00362         /* Entry is not in datacache, but should be in, cache it */
00363         cache_inode_add_data_cache( pentry, ht, pclient, pcontext, &cache_status ) ;
00364         if( ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) && 
00365             ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS ) )
00366           {
00367             /* Entry is not in datacache, but should be in, cache it .
00368              * Several threads may call this function at the first time and a race condition can occur here
00369              * in order to avoid this, cache_inode_add_data_cache is "mutex protected" 
00370              * The first call will create the file content cache entry, the further will return
00371              * with error CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS which is not a pathological thing here */
00372             
00373             /* If we are here, there was an error */
00374             if (nfs_RetryableError( cache_status ) )
00375               {
00376                 return NFS_REQ_DROP;
00377               }
00378             
00379             nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00380                                  preq->rq_vers, 
00381                                  cache_status,
00382                                  &pres->res_read2.status,
00383                                  &pres->res_read3.status,
00384                                  pentry,
00385                                  &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes),
00386                                  NULL, NULL, NULL,
00387                                  NULL, NULL, NULL);
00388             
00389             return NFS_REQ_OK;
00390           }
00391       }
00392     
00393 
00394     if( cache_inode_rdwr( pentry, 
00395                           CACHE_CONTENT_READ, 
00396                           &seek_descriptor,
00397                           size,
00398                           &read_size,
00399                           &attr,
00400                           data, 
00401                           &eof_met,
00402                           ht, 
00403                           pclient, 
00404                           pcontext, 
00405                           &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00406       
00407       {
00408         switch (preq->rq_vers)
00409           {
00410           case NFS_V2:
00411             pres->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.data.nfsdata2_val = data;
00412             pres->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.data.nfsdata2_len = read_size ;
00413 
00414             nfs2_FSALattr_To_Fattr( pexport, &attr,
00415                                     &(pres->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.attributes) ) ;
00416 
00417             pres->res_attr2.status = NFS_OK;
00418             break;
00419 
00420           case NFS_V3:
00421 
00422             pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.eof = FALSE;
00423 
00424             /* Did we reach eof ? */
00425             /* BUGAZOMEU use eof */
00426                                                 if( (offset + read_size) >= attr.filesize )
00427                                                         pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.eof = TRUE;
00428 
00429                                                 /* Build Post Op Attributes */
00430                                                 nfs_SetPostOpAttr( pcontext, pexport,
00431                                pentry, 
00432                                &attr,
00433                                &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.file_attributes) );
00434             
00435                                                 pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.file_attributes.attributes_follow = TRUE;
00436 
00437             pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.count = read_size ;
00438             pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.data.data_val = data;
00439             pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.data.data_len = read_size ;
00440             
00441             pres->res_read3.status = NFS3_OK;
00442             break;
00443           } /* switch */
00444         
00445         return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00446       }
00447         }
00448 
00449         /* If we are here, there was an error */
00450         if (nfs_RetryableError( cache_status ) )
00451         {
00452                 return NFS_REQ_DROP;
00453         }
00454 
00455         nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00456                        preq->rq_vers, 
00457                        cache_status,
00458                        &pres->res_read2.status,
00459                        &pres->res_read3.status,
00460                        pentry,
00461                        &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes),
00462                        NULL, NULL, NULL,
00463                        NULL, NULL, NULL);
00464   
00465                 return NFS_REQ_OK;
00466 } /* nfs_Read */
00467 
00468 
00477 void nfs2_Read_Free(nfs_res_t * resp)
00478 {
00479         if ((resp->res_read2.status == NFS_OK) &&
00480             (resp->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.data.nfsdata2_len != 0))
00481                 Mem_Free(resp->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.data.nfsdata2_val);
00482 } /* nfs2_Read_Free */
00483 
00484 
00493 void nfs3_Read_Free(nfs_res_t * resp)
00494 {
00495         if ((resp->res_read3.status == NFS3_OK) &&
00496             (resp->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.data.data_len != 0))
00497           Mem_Free(resp->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.data.data_val);
00498 } /* nfs3_Read_Free */
